subtitle: Birck Boilermaker Golf Complex at Purdue University - West Lafayette, Indiana
summary: The players, as I recall, generally enjoyed the courses at Purdue University. The Kampen is a Pete Dye designed links style course with plenty of danger areas to avoid. Ackerman Hills is an old wooded American style course with lots of hills. One hole even has a bell at the bottom of a hill to let the tee box know that current group on the fairway has cleared. The players stayed at a Courtyard, dined at Hooters and enjoyed many adult beverages.
awards: The Burritt Cup - Clint Delee, Nat DeRose, Jason Lane, Kyle Burritt

images.title: (L to R) Dan Halverson, Nat DeRose, Jacob Riebe, Clint Delee, Jason Lane, Owen Burritt, Kyle Burritt, Dave Kakareka

subtitle: Coachman's Golf Resort - Edgerton, Wisconsin
summary: Coachman's is a unique resort in that the golf is good, but the accommodations are right from the '70s. Coachman's offers an on site bar and restaurant for dining. The golf package included drink tickets and two dinner meals. The golfers never left the property as there isn't much around Coachman's to get to! Kyle Burritt did make an early Saturday morning run to Dunkin Donuts for the group though. Thanks, Kyle!
awards: The Burritt Cup - Kevin Eck, Jacob Riebe, Nat DeRose, Jason Lane

images.title: (L to R) Nat DeRose, Kyle Burritt, Owen Burritt, Jasob Riebe, Dan Halverson, Dave Kakareka, Jason Lane, Kevin Eck

subtitle: Geneva National Resort - Lake Geneva, Wisconsin
summary: The players really enjoyed the golf at this location. Accommodations were at the swanky Ridge Hotel. All three courses at Geneva National offer many golf challenges. We dined at Sprecher's and the hotel restaurant. On Friday, the group went out to enjoy Lake Geneva bars. During Sunday's golf, a minor incident almost occurred. Dan Halverson had almost tipped a cart over in a sand trap. He saved it with masterful skill and a strong left leg.
awards: The Burritt Cup - Clint Delee, Nat DeRose, Jason Lane

subtitle: Swan Lake Resort - Plymouth, Indiana
summary: As usual, another challenging golf course for this group. The quest for the cup was played in a 4 - 3 format this year. A lot of balls were lost and a lot of fun was had. The group stayed at the Fairway House which was, by far, the best accomodations yet. On Friday, we dined at the famous Dickie's Bar and Grill. On Saturday, we brought enough food to feed Arnie's Army and ate at the House. Lunch was at the sub-par Clubhouse Bar and Grill. We also introduced a new player to the mix, Sean Smith.
awards: The Burritt Cup - Kyle Burritt, Jacob Riebe, Dan Halverson

subtitle: Lake Lawn Lodge - Delavan, WI (lodging and Friday Round)
Hawk's View - Lake Geneva, WI (morning round Saturday)
Barn Hollow - Lake Geneva, WI (Burritt Cup championship round)
Abbey Springs - Fontana, WI (morning round Sunday)
summary: This was definitely a banner year for the Burritt Cup. The players played at four distinct courses, the Burritt Cup round was played on a Par 3 course and three new players were added to the roster!
awards: The Burritt Cup - Clint Delee, Jacob Riebe, Dave Kakareka

subtitle: Meadowbrook Golf Club, Mt. Pleasant, WI (Friday round)
Dretzka Park Golf Course, Milwaukee, WI (Saturday round)
Brown Deer Park Golf Course, Glendale, WI (Sunday round)
Lodging in an AirBnB house, Milwaukee, WI
summary: Another super interesting Burritt Cup year!  The accomodations at the two-flat in Milwaukee were spot on for this group.  Nat cooked up a whole taco dinner for us on Saturday night.  What a great meal that was!  We went to the fabulous Jackson Grill Supper Club on Friday night.  Highly recommend, but don't take the kids! Golf was provided by Wisconsin Golf Trips.  Jason of Wisconsin Golf Trips did an excellent job of putting together our package of courses.
awards: The Burritt Cup - Kyle Burritt, Sean Smith, Jim Kopitke and Justin Niekamp
Most Bogeys - Tie: Kyle Burritt and Kevin Eck

subtitle: Prairie Landing Golf Club, West Chicago, IL (Friday round)
Cantigny Golf Course, Winfield, IL (Saturday round)
summary: This year had serious promise as a premier event.  Planning started early in the year with a consensus on having a Burritt Cup in the Quad Cities and playing TPC John Deere!  Coronavirus killed that!  Rather the alternate plans took us to local courses and a shorter format.  Unfortunately, several cuppers in the recent years were unable to attend this year.  The key highlight of the weekend though was the emergence of Owen Burritt as a winner of his namesake award, finally.  The post celebration made up for the lack of a weekend destination for sure.
awards: The Burritt Cup - Owen Burritt, Dan Halverson, Jacob Riebe, Scott Barnica
